required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Dose-Titration and Open-label Extension Study of SRP-4045 in Advanced Stage Duchenne Muscular Dystrophy (DMD) Patients
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled, Dose-Titration, Safety, Tolerability, and Pharmacokinetics Study Followed by an Open-Label Safety and Efficacy Evaluation of SRP-4045 in Advanced-Stage Patients With Duchenne Muscular Dystrophy Amenable to Exon 45 Skipping

brief_summary.textblock: This is a first-in-human dose-titration and open-label extension study to assess safety, tolerability, and pharmacokinetics of SRP-4045 in advanced-stage Duchenne muscular dystrophy (DMD) patients with deletions amenable to exon 45 skipping.

detailed_description.textblock:
This is a randomized, placebo-controlled dose-titration study to assess safety, tolerability, and pharmacokinetics of 4 dose levels of SRP-4045 in genotypically confirmed advanced-stage DMD patients with deletions amenable to exon 45 skipping.
After completion of the dose-titration portion of the study and SRP-4045 is determined to be safe, all patients will be evaluated on open-label SRP-4045 for the duration of the study.
Safety, including adverse event monitoring, routine laboratory assessments, and cardiac testing will be monitored through the duration of the dose-titration and open-label portions of the study.
Clinical efficacy will be assessed at regularly scheduled study visits via quality of life questionnaires and tests of pulmonary and upper extremity function through the duration of the dose-titration and open-label portions of the trial.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Treatment Emergent Adverse Events (TEAEs)
primary_outcome.description: Adverse event (AE) was any untoward medical occurrence in a clinical trial participant, which does not necessarily have a causal relationship with the investigational drug. AEs also included abnormal physical examination findings (Physical examination were conducted per protocol and any clinically significant abnormal findings were recorded in medical history if pre-existing or addressed as an AE if new or worsening). TEAEs was defined as AEs that started, worsened, or became serious on or after the start of first infusion through 148 weeks. Number of participants with TEAEs were reported.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Potentially Clinically Significant (PCS) Laboratory Abnormalities Reported as TEAEs
primary_outcome.description: Laboratory parameters included serum chemistry (hepatic chemistry and renal chemistry), hematology, coagulation, and urinalysis. Number of participants with potentially clinically significant abnormal finding were reported as TEAEs. The Investigator determined whether abnormal assessment results were potentially clinically significant or not. Potentially clinical significance was defined as any variation in assessment results that had medical relevance resulting in an alteration in medical care.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Potentially Clinically Significant Abnormalities in Vital Signs Reported as TEAEs
primary_outcome.description: Vital sign parameters included systolic blood pressure (SBP), diastolic blood pressure (DBP), heart rate (HR), and body temperature. Number of participants with at least one potentially clinically significant abnormal vital signs findings were reported as TEAEs. The Investigator determined whether abnormal assessment results were potentially clinically significant or not. Potential clinical significance was defined as any variation in assessment results that had medical relevance resulting in an alteration in medical care.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Potentially Clinically Significant Abnormalities in Electrocardiogram (ECG) Reported as TEAEs
primary_outcome.description: Twelve-lead ECGs were performed at a consistent time of day throughout the study. Electrocardiograms were performed only after the participant was in the supine position, resting, and quiet for a minimum of 15 minutes. The ECG was manually reviewed and interpreted by medically qualified personnel. Number of participants with potentially clinically significant abnormalities in ECG reported as TEAEs were presented here. The Investigator determined whether abnormal assessment results were potentially clinically significant or not.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Potentially Clinically Significant Abnormalities in Echocardiograms (ECHO)
primary_outcome.description: Standard, 2-dimensional ECHOs were performed at a consistent time of day throughout the study.The ECHO was reviewed and interpreted by medically qualified personnel. Number of participants with potentially clinically significant abnormalities in ECHO were reported.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-infusion, 5 to 10 minutes, 1, 1.5, 2, 4, 6, 8, 12, 16, and 24 hours post-dose at Weeks 1 (for 4 mg/kg ), 3 (for 10 mg/kg arm), 5 (for 20 mg/kg arm), 7 (for 30 mg/kg arm) in DBP and Week 60 (for 30 mg/kg arm) in OLEP
secondary_outcome.description: Maximum Concentration (Cmax) of casimersen in plasma was evaluated.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to Reach Maximum Plasma Concentration (Tmax) of Casimersen
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-infusion, 5 to 10 minutes, 1, 1.5, 2, 4, 6, 8, 12, 16, and 24 hours post-dose at Weeks 1 (for 4 mg/kg ), 3 (for 10 mg/kg arm), 5 (for 20 mg/kg arm), 7 (for 30 mg/kg arm) in DBP and Week 60 (for 30 mg/kg arm) in OLEP
secondary_outcome.description: Time to reach maximum plasma concentration (Tmax) of casimersen was evaluated.

secondary_outcome.measure: Area Under Concentration-time Curve From Time of Dosing to the Last Measurable Concentration (AUClast) of Casimersen in Plasma
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-infusion, 5 to 10 minutes, 1, 1.5, 2, 4, 6, 8, 12, 16, and 24 hours post-dose at Weeks 1 (for 4 mg/kg ), 3 (for 10 mg/kg arm), 5 (for 20 mg/kg arm), 7 (for 30 mg/kg arm) in DBP and Week 60 (for 30 mg/kg arm) in OLEP
secondary_outcome.description: Area under the concentration-time curve from time zero to the last quantifiable concentration of casimersen in plasma were evaluated.

secondary_outcome.measure: Area Under Concentration-Time Curve From Time Zero Pre-dose to Twenty-Four Hours Post-dose (AUC0-24) of Casimersen in Plasma
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-infusion, 5 to 10 minutes, 1, 1.5, 2, 4, 6, 8, 12, 16, and 24 hours post-dose at Weeks 1 (for 4 mg/kg ), 3 (for 10 mg/kg arm), 5 (for 20 mg/kg arm), 7 (for 30 mg/kg arm) in DBP and Week 60 (for 30 mg/kg arm) in OLEP
secondary_outcome.description: Area under concentration-time curve from time zero pre-dose to twenty-four hours post-dos of casimersen in plasma were evaluated.

secondary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Concentration-Time Curve From Time Zero Extrapolated to the Infinity (AUCinf) of Casimersen in Plasma
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-infusion, 5 to 10 minutes, 1, 1.5, 2, 4, 6, 8, 12, 16, and 24 hours post-dose at Weeks 1 (for 4 mg/kg ), 3 (for 10 mg/kg arm), 5 (for 20 mg/kg arm), 7 (for 30 mg/kg arm) in DBP and Week 60 (for 30 mg/kg arm) in OLEP
secondary_outcome.description: Area under the concentration-time curve from time zero extrapolated to the infinity of casimersen in plasma was evaluated.

secondary_outcome.measure: Apparent Volume of Distribution at Steady State (Vss) of Casimersen
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-infusion, 5 to 10 minutes, 1, 1.5, 2, 4, 6, 8, 12, 16, and 24 hours post-dose at Weeks 1 (for 4 mg/kg ), 3 (for 10 mg/kg arm), 5 (for 20 mg/kg arm), 7 (for 30 mg/kg arm) in DBP and Week 60 (for 30 mg/kg arm) in OLEP
secondary_outcome.description: Volume of distribution was defined as the theoretical volume in which the total amount of drug would need to be uniformly distributed to produce the desired plasma concentration of a drug. Apparent volume of distribution at steady state of casimersen was evaluated.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-infusion, 5 to 10 minutes, 1, 1.5, 2, 4, 6, 8, 12, 16, and 24 hours post-dose at Weeks 1 (for 4 mg/kg ), 3 (for 10 mg/kg arm), 5 (for 20 mg/kg arm), 7 (for 30 mg/kg arm) in DBP and Week 60 (for 30 mg/kg arm) in OLEP
secondary_outcome.description: T1/2 is the time measured for the plasma concentration of drug to decrease by one half. T1/2 of casimersen was evaluated.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-infusion, 5 to 10 minutes, 1, 1.5, 2, 4, 6, 8, 12, 16, and 24 hours post-dose at Weeks 1 (for 4 mg/kg ), 3 (for 10 mg/kg arm), 5 (for 20 mg/kg arm), 7 (for 30 mg/kg arm) in DBP and Week 60 (for 30 mg/kg arm) in OLEP
secondary_outcome.description: Drug clearance is a quantitative measure of the rate at which a drug substance is removed from the blood. CL of casimersen was evaluated.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Residence Time Extrapolated to Infinity (MRTinf) of Casimersen
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-infusion, 5 to 10 minutes, 1, 1.5, 2, 4, 6, 8, 12, 16, and 24 hours post-dose at Weeks 1 (for 4 mg/kg ), 3 (for 10 mg/kg arm), 5 (for 20 mg/kg arm), 7 (for 30 mg/kg arm) in DBP and Week 60 (for 30 mg/kg arm) in OLEP
secondary_outcome.description: MRTinf = AUMCinf/AUCinf - T/2, where T was the infusion duration, and AUMCinf was the area under the first moment curve from time 0 extrapolated to infinite time, calculated using the linear/log trapezoidal method. MRTinf of casimersen was evaluated.

secondary_outcome.measure: Double-Blind Period: Renal Clearance (CLR) of Casimersen
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 0 to 4, 4 to 8, 8 to 12, and 12 to 24 hours post-dose at Weeks 1 (for 4 mg/kg ), 3 (for 10 mg/kg arm), 5 (for 20 mg/kg arm), 7 and 12 (for 30 mg/kg arm) in double-blind period
secondary_outcome.description: Renal clearance was calculated using the partial AUC0-24 from the non-compartmental analysis in plasma and AE0-24. AUC0-24 was defined as area under the plasma concentration-time curve, from time 0 to 24 hours after completion of dosing. AE0-24 was defined as total cumulative amount excreted from 0 to 24 hours. Summarized data of all urine collection intervals are reported.

arm_group.description: Participants with genotypically confirmed Duchenne muscular dystrophy (DMD) characterized by deletions amenable to exon 45 skipping will receive placebo-matching to casimersen intravenous (IV) infusions, once weekly over approximately 12 weeks in the double-blind period.

Participants with genotypically confirmed DMD characterized by deletions amenable to exon 45 skipping will receive weekly IV infusions of casimersen at four escalating dose levels, each for at least 2 weeks: 4 milligrams per kilograms (mg/kg) during Week 1 to Week 2, followed by 10 mg/kg during Week 3 to Week 4, followed by 20 mg/kg during Week 5 to Week 6, followed by 30 mg/kg beginning at Week 7 and continue over approximately Week 12 in the double-blind period.
All participants who completed double blind period will be enrolled to receive casimersen 30 mg/kg once weekly, for up to Week 144 in the open label extension period.

intervention.description: SRP-4045 placebo-matching solution for IV infusion.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Genotypically confirmed DMD (amenable to exon 45 skipping).
- Stable cardiac and pulmonary function.
- Limited or no ambulation.
- On a stable dose of oral corticosteroids for at least 24 weeks OR has not received corticosteroids for at least 24 weeks.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Current or previous treatment with the experimental agents SMT C1100 (BMN-195) or PRO045.
- Other experimental treatment in the past 12 weeks.
- If on cardiac medication, must be on a stable dose for the past 12 weeks.
- Major surgery within the past 3 months.
Other inclusion/exclusion criteria apply.

facility.name: David Geffen School of Medicine at UCLA
Ann & Robert H. Lurie Children's Hospital of Chicago

participant_flow.recruitment_details: The study was conducted at 3 sites in United States.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Study conducted in 2 parts: Part 1 (Double-Blind Period [DBP]) and Part 2 (Open Label Extension Period [OLEP]). When Part 1 was completed and cumulative safety data was reviewed by an independent Data Safety Monitoring Board (DSMB), Part 2 was conducted.

group.title: Double-Blind Period: Placebo
group.description: Participants with genotypically confirmed Duchenne muscular dystrophy (DMD) characterized by deletions amenable to exon 45 skipping received placebo-matched to casimersen intravenous (IV) infusions, once weekly over approximately 12 weeks in the double-blind period.

group.title: Double-Blind Period: Casimersen
group.description: Participants with genotypically confirmed DMD characterized by deletions amenable to exon 45 skipping received weekly IV infusions of casimersen at four escalating dose levels, each for at least 2 weeks: 4 milligrams per kilograms (mg/kg) during Week 1 to Week 2, followed by 10 mg/kg during Week 3 to Week 4, followed by 20 mg/kg during Week 5 to Week 6, followed by 30 mg/kg beginning at Week 7 and continued over approximately Week 12 in the double-blind period.

group.title: Open Label Extension Period: Casimersen
group.description: All participants who completed double blind period were enrolled to receive casimersen 30 mg/kg once weekly, for up to Week 144 in the open label extension period.

participants_list.participants: All participants from the double-blind period amenable to exon 45 skipping were enrolled to open-label extension period.

baseline.population: Safety set included all randomized participants who received at least 1 dose of study drug (casimersen or placebo) in double-blind period.

group.title: Double-Blind Period: Placebo
group.description: Participants with genotypically confirmed DMD characterized by deletions amenable to exon 45 skipping received placebo-matched to casimersen IV infusions, once weekly over approximately 12 weeks in the double-blind period.

group.title: Double-Blind Period: Casimersen
group.description: Participants with genotypically confirmed DMD characterized by deletions amenable to exon 45 skipping received weekly IV infusions of casimersen at four escalating dose levels, each for at least 2 weeks: 4 mg/kg during Week 1 to Week 2, followed by 10 mg/kg during Week 3 to Week 4, followed by 20 mg/kg during Week 5 to Week 6, followed by 30 mg/kg beginning at Week 7 and continued over approximately Week 12 in the double-blind period.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

category.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Treatment Emergent Adverse Events (TEAEs)
outcome.description: Adverse event (AE) was any untoward medical occurrence in a clinical trial participant, which does not necessarily have a causal relationship with the investigational drug. AEs also included abnormal physical examination findings (Physical examination were conducted per protocol and any clinically significant abnormal findings were recorded in medical history if pre-existing or addressed as an AE if new or worsening). TEAEs was defined as AEs that started, worsened, or became serious on or after the start of first infusion through 148 weeks. Number of participants with TEAEs were reported.
outcome.population: Safety set included all randomized participants who received at least 1 dose of study drug (casimersen or placebo) in both double-blind and open-label extension periods.

group.title: Double-Blind Period: Placebo
group.description: Participants with genotypically confirmed DMD characterized by deletions amenable to exon 45 skipping received placebo-matched to casimersen IV infusions, once weekly over approximately 12 weeks in the double-blind period.

group.title: Double-Blind Period: Casimersen 4 mg/kg
group.description: Participants with genotypically confirmed DMD characterized by deletions amenable to exon 45 skipping received casimersen IV infusions, at a dose level of 4 mg/kg once weekly for 2 weeks (i.e. Week 1 to Week 2) in the double-blind period.

group.title: Double-Blind Period: Casimersen 10 mg/kg
group.description: Participants with genotypically confirmed DMD characterized by deletions amenable to exon 45 skipping received casimersen IV infusions, at a dose level of 10 mg/kg once weekly for 2 weeks (i.e. Week 3 to Week 4) in the double-blind period.

group.title: Double-Blind Period: Casimersen 20 mg/kg
group.description: Participants with genotypically confirmed DMD characterized by deletions amenable to exon 45 skipping received casimersen IV infusions, at a dose level of 20 mg/kg once weekly for 2 weeks (i.e. Week 5 to Week 6) in the double-blind period.

group.title: Double-Blind Period: Casimersen 30 mg/kg
group.description: Participants with genotypically confirmed DMD characterized by deletions amenable to exon 45 skipping received casimersen IV infusions, at a dose level of 30 mg/kg once weekly from Week 7 to Week 12 in the double-blind period.

group.title: Open Label Extension Period: Casimersen 30 mg/kg
group.description: All participants who completed double blind period were enrolled to receive casimersen 30 mg/kg once weekly, for up to Week 144 in the open label extension period.

outcome.title: Maximum Plasma Concentration (Cmax) of Casimersen
outcome.description: Maximum Concentration (Cmax) of casimersen in plasma was evaluated.
outcome.time_frame: Pre-infusion, 5 to 10 minutes, 1, 1.5, 2, 4, 6, 8, 12, 16, and 24 hours post-dose at Weeks 1 (for 4 mg/kg ), 3 (for 10 mg/kg arm), 5 (for 20 mg/kg arm), 7 (for 30 mg/kg arm) in DBP and Week 60 (for 30 mg/kg arm) in OLEP
outcome.population: Pharmacokinetic (PK) set included all randomized participants who received the planned full dose of study drug (casimersen) and for whom there are adequate PK samples from which to estimate PK parameters. Data was not planned to be collected and analyzed for placebo arm.

group.title: Double-Blind Period: Casimersen 4 mg/kg
group.description: Participants with genotypically confirmed DMD characterized by deletions amenable to exon 45 skipping received casimersen IV infusions, at a dose level of 4 mg/kg once weekly for 2 weeks (i.e. Week 1 to Week 2) in the double-blind period.

measure.title: Maximum Plasma Concentration (Cmax) of Casimersen
measure.description: Maximum Concentration (Cmax) of casimersen in plasma was evaluated.
measure.population: Pharmacokinetic (PK) set included all randomized participants who received the planned full dose of study drug (casimersen) and for whom there are adequate PK samples from which to estimate PK parameters. Data was not planned to be collected and analyzed for placebo arm.

outcome.title: Time to Reach Maximum Plasma Concentration (Tmax) of Casimersen
outcome.description: Time to reach maximum plasma concentration (Tmax) of casimersen was evaluated.

outcome.description: Area under the concentration-time curve from time zero extrapolated to the infinity of casimersen in plasma was evaluated.
outcome.time_frame: Pre-infusion, 5 to 10 minutes, 1, 1.5, 2, 4, 6, 8, 12, 16, and 24 hours post-dose at Weeks 1 (for 4 mg/kg ), 3 (for 10 mg/kg arm), 5 (for 20 mg/kg arm), 7 (for 30 mg/kg arm) in DBP and Week 60 (for 30 mg/kg arm) in OLEP
outcome.population: PK set included all randomized participants who received the planned full dose of study drug (casimersen or placebo) and for whom there are adequate PK samples from which to estimate PK parameters. Here, "Overall number of participants analyzed" = number of participants evaluable for this outcome. Data was not planned to be collected and analyzed for placebo arm.

group.description: Participants with genotypically confirmed DMD characterized by deletions amenable to exon 45 skipping received casimersen IV infusions, at a dose level of 4 mg/kg once weekly for 2 weeks (i.e. Week 1 to Week 2) in the double-blind period.

measure.title: Area Under the Concentration-Time Curve From Time Zero Extrapolated to the Infinity (AUCinf) of Casimersen in Plasma
measure.description: Area under the concentration-time curve from time zero extrapolated to the infinity of casimersen in plasma was evaluated.
measure.population: PK set included all randomized participants who received the planned full dose of study drug (casimersen or placebo) and for whom there are adequate PK samples from which to estimate PK parameters. Here, "Overall number of participants analyzed" = number of participants evaluable for this outcome. Data was not planned to be collected and analyzed for placebo arm.

outcome.title: Apparent Volume of Distribution at Steady State (Vss) of Casimersen
outcome.description: Volume of distribution was defined as the theoretical volume in which the total amount of drug would need to be uniformly distributed to produce the desired plasma concentration of a drug. Apparent volume of distribution at steady state of casimersen was evaluated.
outcome.time_frame: Pre-infusion, 5 to 10 minutes, 1, 1.5, 2, 4, 6, 8, 12, 16, and 24 hours post-dose at Weeks 1 (for 4 mg/kg ), 3 (for 10 mg/kg arm), 5 (for 20 mg/kg arm), 7 (for 30 mg/kg arm) in DBP and Week 60 (for 30 mg/kg arm) in OLEP
outcome.population: PK set included all randomized participants who received the planned full dose of study drug (casimersen or placebo) and for whom there are adequate PK samples from which to estimate PK parameters. Here, "Overall number of participants analyzed" = number of participants evaluable for this outcome. Data was not planned to be collected and analyzed for placebo arm.

group.description: Participants with genotypically confirmed DMD characterized by deletions amenable to exon 45 skipping received casimersen IV infusions, at a dose level of 4 mg/kg once weekly for 2 weeks (i.e. Week 1 to Week 2) in the double-blind period.

measure.title: Apparent Volume of Distribution at Steady State (Vss) of Casimersen
measure.description: Volume of distribution was defined as the theoretical volume in which the total amount of drug would need to be uniformly distributed to produce the desired plasma concentration of a drug. Apparent volume of distribution at steady state of casimersen was evaluated.
measure.population: PK set included all randomized participants who received the planned full dose of study drug (casimersen or placebo) and for whom there are adequate PK samples from which to estimate PK parameters. Here, "Overall number of participants analyzed" = number of participants evaluable for this outcome. Data was not planned to be collected and analyzed for placebo arm.

outcome.title: Elimination Half-life (T1/2) of Casimersen
outcome.description: T1/2 is the time measured for the plasma concentration of drug to decrease by one half. T1/2 of casimersen was evaluated.
outcome.time_frame: Pre-infusion, 5 to 10 minutes, 1, 1.5, 2, 4, 6, 8, 12, 16, and 24 hours post-dose at Weeks 1 (for 4 mg/kg ), 3 (for 10 mg/kg arm), 5 (for 20 mg/kg arm), 7 (for 30 mg/kg arm) in DBP and Week 60 (for 30 mg/kg arm) in OLEP
outcome.population: PK set included all randomized participants who received the planned full dose of study drug (casimersen or placebo) and for whom there are adequate PK samples from which to estimate PK parameters. Here, "Overall number of participants analyzed" = number of participants evaluable for this outcome. Data was not planned to be collected and analyzed for placebo arm.

group.title: Double-Blind Period: Casimersen 4 mg/kg
group.description: Participants with genotypically confirmed DMD characterized by deletions amenable to exon 45 skipping received casimersen IV infusions, at a dose level of 4 mg/kg once weekly for 2 weeks (i.e. Week 1 to Week 2) in the double-blind period.

measure.title: Elimination Half-life (T1/2) of Casimersen
measure.description: T1/2 is the time measured for the plasma concentration of drug to decrease by one half. T1/2 of casimersen was evaluated.
measure.population: PK set included all randomized participants who received the planned full dose of study drug (casimersen or placebo) and for whom there are adequate PK samples from which to estimate PK parameters. Here, "Overall number of participants analyzed" = number of participants evaluable for this outcome. Data was not planned to be collected and analyzed for placebo arm.

outcome.title: Total Clearance (CL) of Casimersen
outcome.description: Drug clearance is a quantitative measure of the rate at which a drug substance is removed from the blood. CL of casimersen was evaluated.
outcome.time_frame: Pre-infusion, 5 to 10 minutes, 1, 1.5, 2, 4, 6, 8, 12, 16, and 24 hours post-dose at Weeks 1 (for 4 mg/kg ), 3 (for 10 mg/kg arm), 5 (for 20 mg/kg arm), 7 (for 30 mg/kg arm) in DBP and Week 60 (for 30 mg/kg arm) in OLEP
outcome.population: PK set included all randomized participants who received the planned full dose of study drug (casimersen or placebo) and for whom there are adequate PK samples from which to estimate PK parameters. Here, "Overall number of participants analyzed" = number of participants evaluable for this outcome. Data was not planned to be collected and analyzed for placebo arm.

group.title: Double-Blind Period: Casimersen 4 mg/kg
group.description: Participants with genotypically confirmed DMD characterized by deletions amenable to exon 45 skipping received casimersen IV infusions, at a dose level of 4 mg/kg once weekly for 2 weeks (i.e. Week 1 to Week 2) in the double-blind period.

group.title: Double-Blind Period: Casimersen 10 mg/kg
group.description: Participants with genotypically confirmed DMD characterized by deletions amenable to exon 45 skipping received casimersen IV infusions, at a dose level of 10 mg/kg once weekly for 2 weeks (i.e. Week 3 to Week 4) in the double-blind period.

group.title: Double-Blind Period: Casimersen 20 mg/kg
group.description: Participants with genotypically confirmed DMD characterized by deletions amenable to exon 45 skipping received casimersen IV infusions, at a dose level of 20 mg/kg once weekly for 2 weeks (i.e. Week 5 to Week 6) in the double-blind period.

group.title: Double-Blind Period: Casimersen 30 mg/kg
group.description: Participants with genotypically confirmed DMD characterized by deletions amenable to exon 45 skipping received casimersen IV infusions, at a dose level of 30 mg/kg once weekly from Week 7 to Week 12 in the double-blind period.

group.title: Open Label Extension Period: Casimersen 30 mg/kg
group.description: All participants who completed double blind period were enrolled to receive casimersen 30 mg/kg once weekly, for up to Week 144 in the open label extension period.

measure.title: Total Clearance (CL) of Casimersen
measure.description: Drug clearance is a quantitative measure of the rate at which a drug substance is removed from the blood. CL of casimersen was evaluated.
measure.population: PK set included all randomized participants who received the planned full dose of study drug (casimersen or placebo) and for whom there are adequate PK samples from which to estimate PK parameters. Here, "Overall number of participants analyzed" = number of participants evaluable for this outcome. Data was not planned to be collected and analyzed for placebo arm.

outcome.title: Mean Residence Time Extrapolated to Infinity (MRTinf) of Casimersen
outcome.description: MRTinf = AUMCinf/AUCinf - T/2, where T was the infusion duration, and AUMCinf was the area under the first moment curve from time 0 extrapolated to infinite time, calculated using the linear/log trapezoidal method. MRTinf of casimersen was evaluated.
outcome.time_frame: Pre-infusion, 5 to 10 minutes, 1, 1.5, 2, 4, 6, 8, 12, 16, and 24 hours post-dose at Weeks 1 (for 4 mg/kg ), 3 (for 10 mg/kg arm), 5 (for 20 mg/kg arm), 7 (for 30 mg/kg arm) in DBP and Week 60 (for 30 mg/kg arm) in OLEP
outcome.population: PK set included all randomized participants who received the planned full dose of study drug (casimersen or placebo) and for whom there are adequate PK samples from which to estimate PK parameters. Here, "Overall number of participants analyzed" = number of participants evaluable for this outcome. Data was not planned to be collected and analyzed for placebo arm.

group.title: Double-Blind Period: Casimersen 4 mg/kg
group.description: Participants with genotypically confirmed DMD characterized by deletions amenable to exon 45 skipping received casimersen IV infusions, at a dose level of 4 mg/kg once weekly for 2 weeks (i.e. Week 1 to Week 2) in the double-blind period.

group.title: Double-Blind Period: Casimersen 10 mg/kg
group.description: Participants with genotypically confirmed DMD characterized by deletions amenable to exon 45 skipping received casimersen IV infusions, at a dose level of 10 mg/kg once weekly for 2 weeks (i.e. Week 3 to Week 4) in the double-blind period.

group.title: Double-Blind Period: Casimersen 20 mg/kg
group.description: Participants with genotypically confirmed DMD characterized by deletions amenable to exon 45 skipping received casimersen IV infusions, at a dose level of 20 mg/kg once weekly for 2 weeks (i.e. Week 5 to Week 6) in the double-blind period.

group.title: Double-Blind Period: Casimersen 30 mg/kg
group.description: Participants with genotypically confirmed DMD characterized by deletions amenable to exon 45 skipping received casimersen IV infusions, at a dose level of 30 mg/kg once weekly from Week 7 to Week 12 in the double-blind period.

group.title: Open Label Extension Period: Casimersen 30 mg/kg
group.description: All participants who completed double blind period were enrolled to receive casimersen 30 mg/kg once weekly, for up to Week 144 in the open label extension period.

measure.title: Mean Residence Time Extrapolated to Infinity (MRTinf) of Casimersen
measure.description: MRTinf = AUMCinf/AUCinf - T/2, where T was the infusion duration, and AUMCinf was the area under the first moment curve from time 0 extrapolated to infinite time, calculated using the linear/log trapezoidal method. MRTinf of casimersen was evaluated.
measure.population: PK set included all randomized participants who received the planned full dose of study drug (casimersen or placebo) and for whom there are adequate PK samples from which to estimate PK parameters. Here, "Overall number of participants analyzed" = number of participants evaluable for this outcome. Data was not planned to be collected and analyzed for placebo arm.

outcome.title: Double-Blind Period: Renal Clearance (CLR) of Casimersen
outcome.description: Renal clearance was calculated using the partial AUC0-24 from the non-compartmental analysis in plasma and AE0-24. AUC0-24 was defined as area under the plasma concentration-time curve, from time 0 to 24 hours after completion of dosing. AE0-24 was defined as total cumulative amount excreted from 0 to 24 hours. Summarized data of all urine collection intervals are reported.
outcome.time_frame: 0 to 4, 4 to 8, 8 to 12, and 12 to 24 hours post-dose at Weeks 1 (for 4 mg/kg ), 3 (for 10 mg/kg arm), 5 (for 20 mg/kg arm), 7 and 12 (for 30 mg/kg arm) in double-blind period
outcome.population: PK set included all randomized participants who received the planned full dose of study drug (casimersen or placebo) and for whom there are adequate PK samples from which to estimate PK parameters. Here, "Overall number of participants analyzed"= number of participants evaluable for this outcome. Data was not planned to be collected and analyzed for placebo and open-label extension period arm.

group.title: Double-Blind Period: Casimersen 4 mg/kg
group.description: Participants with genotypically confirmed DMD characterized by deletions amenable to exon 45 skipping received casimersen IV infusions, at a dose level of 4 mg/kg once weekly for 2 weeks (i.e. Week 1 to Week 2) in the double-blind period.

group.title: Double-Blind Period: Casimersen 10 mg/kg
group.description: Participants with genotypically confirmed DMD characterized by deletions amenable to exon 45 skipping received casimersen IV infusions, at a dose level of 10 mg/kg once weekly for 2 weeks (i.e. Week 3 to Week 4) in the double-blind period.

group.title: Double-Blind Period: Casimersen 20 mg/kg
group.description: Participants with genotypically confirmed DMD characterized by deletions amenable to exon 45 skipping received casimersen IV infusions, at a dose level of 20 mg/kg once weekly for 2 weeks (i.e. Week 5 to Week 6) in the double-blind period.

group.title: Double-Blind Period: Casimersen 30 mg/kg
group.description: Participants with genotypically confirmed DMD characterized by deletions amenable to exon 45 skipping received casimersen IV infusions, at a dose level of 30 mg/kg once weekly from Week 7 to Week 12 in the double-blind period.

measure.title: Double-Blind Period: Renal Clearance (CLR) of Casimersen
measure.description: Renal clearance was calculated using the partial AUC0-24 from the non-compartmental analysis in plasma and AE0-24. AUC0-24 was defined as area under the plasma concentration-time curve, from time 0 to 24 hours after completion of dosing. AE0-24 was defined as total cumulative amount excreted from 0 to 24 hours. Summarized data of all urine collection intervals are reported.
measure.population: PK set included all randomized participants who received the planned full dose of study drug (casimersen or placebo) and for whom there are adequate PK samples from which to estimate PK parameters. Here, "Overall number of participants analyzed"= number of participants evaluable for this outcome. Data was not planned to be collected and analyzed for placebo and open-label extension period arm.

reported_events.time_frame: From start of study drug administration up to Week 148

group.title: Double-Blind Period: Placebo
group.description: Participants with genotypically confirmed DMD characterized by deletions amenable to exon 45 skipping received placebo-matched to casimersen IV infusions, once weekly over approximately 12 weeks in the double-blind period.

group.title: Double-Blind Period: Casimersen 4 mg/kg
group.description: Participants with genotypically confirmed DMD characterized by deletions amenable to exon 45 skipping received casimersen IV infusions, at a dose level of 4 mg/kg once weekly for 2 weeks (i.e. Week 1 to Week 2) in the double-blind period.

group.title: Double-Blind Period: Casimersen 30 mg/kg
group.description: Participants with genotypically confirmed DMD characterized by deletions amenable to exon 45 skipping received casimersen IV infusions, at a dose level of 30 mg/kg once weekly from Week 7 to Week 12 in the double-blind period.

group.title: Open Label Extension Period: Casimersen 30 mg/kg
group.description: All participants who completed double blind period were enrolled to receive casimersen 30 mg/kg once weekly, for up to Week 144 in the open label extension period.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The most restrictive relevant agreement provides that the PI can only publish the study results with the approval of Sponsor.
